reg_pit.title: The Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction

change.changenote: Table and Heading BEFORE amended editorially, effective December 15, 2011.

section.indent1: As of February 1, 2010 the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspect of International Child Abduction was in effect between Canada and the following countries:

tablerow.tablecol: Denmark (except the Faroe Islands and Greenland)
Hong Kong (Special Administration Region of China)

change.changenote: Acceding countries list BEFORE amended editorially, effective December 15, 2011.

schedule.indent1: Acceding countries with which Canada does not have an agreement in force:

change.changenote: Table and heading BEFORE amended editorially, effective July 1, 2013.

schedule.indent1: As of February 1, 2010 the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspect of International Child Abduction was in effect between Canada and the following countries:

tablerow.tablecol: Denmark (except the Faroe Islands and Greenland)
Hong Kong (Special Administration Region of China)

schedule.indent1: Acceding countries with which Canada does not have an agreement in force:
schedule.indent2: Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Dominican Republic, Gabon, Guatemala, Morocco, Nicaragua, Russian Federation, San Marino, Seychelles, Singapore, Thailand, Ukraine.

change.changenote: Table and heading BEFORE amended editorially, effective August 26, 2014.

bcl:schedule.bcl:indent1: As of July 1, 2013 the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction was in effect between Canada and the following countries:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Denmark (except the Faroe Islands and Greenland)
Hong Kong (Special Administration Region of China)

bcl:schedule.bcl:indent1: Acceding countries with which Canada does not have an agreement in force:
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent2: Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Dominican Republic, Gabon, Guatemala, Guinea, Kazakhstan, Lesotho, Morocco, Nicaragua, Republic of Korea, Russian Federation, San Marino, Seychelles, Singapore, Thailand and Ukraine.

change.changenote: "Morocco" was removed from the Table and added to the list of acceding countries editorially, effective April 18, 2016.
"Republic of the Philippines," was added to the list of acceding countries editorially, effective March 15, 2017.
Table heading BEFORE amended editorially, effective July 1, 2017.
change.bcl:indent1: As of March 15, 2017 the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction was in effect between Canada and the following countries:
change.changenote: "Russian Federation" was removed from the Table and added to the list of acceding countries editorially, effective July 1, 2017.
"Morroco" was added to the table and removed from the list of acceding countries editorially, effective July 1, 2017.
change.bcl:indent1: Acceding countries with which Canada does not have an agreement in force:
change.bcl:indent2: Armenia, Gabon, Guatemala, Guinea, Iraq, Kazakhstan, Republic of Korea, Lesotho, Morocco, Nicaragua, Republic of the Philippines, Seychelles, Thailand and Republic of Zambia.

change.changenote: Heading BEFORE amended editorially, effective October 1, 2017
change.bcl:lefttext: The text of the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction is published in the B.C. Gazette Part II, Volume 27 (1984), No. 2, page 5.
change.bcl:indent1: For any further information about the Convention, contact
As of July 1, 2017 the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction was in effect between Canada and the following countries:
change.changenote: Acceding countries list BEFORE amended editorially, effective October 1, 2017
change.bcl:indent1: Acceding countries with which Canada does not have an agreement in force:
change.bcl:indent2: Armenia, Bolivia, Gabon, Guatemala, Guinea, Iraq, Jamaica, Kazakhstan, Republic of Korea, Lesotho, Nicaragua, Pakistan, Republic of the Philippines, Russian Federation, Seychelles, Thailand and Republic of Zambia.
